alert.note: Alert for Sacramento; San Joaquin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 9:59PM PST until January 02 at 5:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Cosumnes River Near McConnell affecting San Joaquin and Sacramento Counties. For the Cosumnes River...including Michigan Bar, McConnell ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cosumnes River near McConnell. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM PST Saturday the stage was 42.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 46.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 46.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 46.3 feet on 12/23/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1000 AM PST.
